2. Available data

Source: vignettes/2_datasets.Rmd
2_datasets.Rmd


Accessing registry tables

To make

library(chronosphere)
#> Chronosphere - Evolving Earth System Variables
#> Important: never fetch data as a superuser / with admin. privileges!
#> 
#> Note that the package was split for efficient maintenance and development:
#>  - Plate tectonic calculations -> package 'rgplates'
#>  - Arrays of raster and vector spatials -> package 'via'

Available database - variable combinations can be inspected with the datasets() funciton:

dats <- datasets()
#> Use datasets(dat = <dat>) to see available versions and resolutions.
str(dats)
#> 'data.frame':    20 obs. of  9 variables:
#>  $ topic          : chr  NA NA "Paleogeography" "Paleogeography" ...
#>  $ databaseName   : chr  "Code, used data and supplementary items for the articled Increase in marine provinciality over the last 250 mil"| __truncated__ "Repository for: Reddin et al. 2020. Marine clade sensitivities to climate change conform across time scales" "The PALEOMAP project" "The PALEOMAP project" ...
#>  $ dat            : chr  "SOM-kocsis-provinciality" "SOM-reddin-sensitivity" "paleomap" "paleomap" ...
#>  $ variableName   : chr  "S6. Interpolated  temperature  reconstructions  based  on  the  HadCM3L  climate  models  and  the PaleoMAP Paleocoastlines" "Modern metaanalysis support data" "PaleoMAP Paleodigital Elevation Models" "Plate tectonic reconstruction" ...
#>  $ var            : chr  "sstinter" "modern" "dem" "model" ...
#>  $ defaultVariable: logi  TRUE TRUE TRUE FALSE FALSE TRUE ...
#>  $ defaultClass   : chr  "RasterArray" "data.frame" "RasterArray" "platemodel" ...
#>  $ infoURL        : chr  "http://www.chronosphere-portal.org/" "http://www.chronosphere-portal.org/" "wwww.chronosphere-portal.org/placeholder" "wwww.chronosphere-portal.org/placeholder" ...
#>  $ defaultVer     : chr  "v1.0" "Version 1" "20180801" "v19o_r1c" ...

Database-specific variables

The datasets() function in its default argumentation does not give information on what exact items are available. As these can be quite numerous.

To see what kind of data are available in the paleomap entries

pm <- datasets('paleomap')
str(pm)
#> 'data.frame':    5 obs. of  42 variables:
#>  $ dataID           : int  3 4 5 6 27
#>  $ topic            : chr  "Paleogeography" "Paleogeography" "Paleogeography" "Paleogeography" ...
#>  $ dat              : chr  "paleomap" "paleomap" "paleomap" "paleomap" ...
#>  $ databaseName     : chr  "The PALEOMAP project" "The PALEOMAP project" "The PALEOMAP project" "The PALEOMAP project" ...
#>  $ sourceURL        : chr  "www.scotese.com" "www.scotese.com" "www.scotese.com" "www.scotese.com" ...
#>  $ variableID       : int  3 4 3 4 19
#>  $ var              : chr  "dem" "model" "dem" "model" ...

#>  $ infoURL          : chr  "wwww.chronosphere-portal.org/placeholder" "wwww.chronosphere-portal.org/placeholder" "wwww.chronosphere-portal.org/placeholder" "wwww.chronosphere-portal.org/placeholder" ...
